history.text: Have you seen the movie Bruce Almighty before?
Hello there, did you like Bruce Almighty? Who was your favorite character?
Yes, it was hilarious
Yes. I did like the movie. I like Jim Carrey. He always has some funny roles.
Yes, he does. Wasn't Steve Carrell in this movie also?
I thought he was really good in his role as a news reporter in this movie.
Who was your favorite character in the movie?
He was really complaining in this movie-I guess he got what he was looking for
Mine was Morgan Freeman's role as God
Yes. He is one of my favorite actors also. He always plays such strong character roles.
Evan Baxter was a jerk though. He added fuel to the fire
Yes he did. I think Jennifer Aniston played the role as the girlfriend really good.
Yes she did, but she kind of made me mad in how she didn't support Bruce
I know. I felt bad that he had such a hard time of it through the movie. He always seemed to be plagued by bad luck.
One of the funniest parts was when he encountered the group of guys in the alley
Yes. I also like the part where he had the crush on his co-worker but she didn't pay any attention to him.
It was hilarious when he told WKBW to shove it. He had to know that he would be fired
And on live TV, no less
I know. I thought it was so funny when he used his powers to cause Evan to be fired.
I wish I could type as fast as Bruce did when answering those emails!
I know it. Can you imagine trying to answer everyone's prayers by e-mail. That would be impossible, as I'm sure he found out.
Yes, and deciding who to say yes to, and who to reject. That dog of his had a potty problem didn't he?
Can you imagine how disturbing to have voices in your head suddenly?
I think he just told everyone yes, to make everyone happy. Don't you know that Grace was so disappointed when he didn't propose to her when they went out to eat.
I would have been as well, but I guess if you don't have expectations you can't be disappointed
She finally got her wish, though. On live TV
That's true. I really liked the part where God told Bruce to pray for what he really wanted. And he prays for Grace to find a man that would make her happy. That was a touching scene.
Very touching indeed. As was the ending scene with Morgan Freeman holding the sign. That was a good movie for it's time
Yes it was. It's hard to believe that it came out in 2003. I have watched it several times since then, and it's always enjoyable.
The ratings don't seem right though, I would give it at least 7/10
I know. I would too. That's one reason I am not a big fan of the Rotten Tomatoes rating system. They are not very accurate at times.
